alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz; Kofa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 6:12PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central La Paz and northeastern Yuma Counties through 715 PM MST... At 611 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles west of Sundad, or 45 miles southwest of Tonopah, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central La Paz and northeastern Yuma Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
